meanings.definition: A soft, moist, shapeless mass of matter.
meanings.sent1: The orange had a juicy pulp inside.
meanings.sent2: She squeezed the pulp to make orange juice.
meanings.sent3: The pulp felt squishy between her fingers.
meanings.sent4: The pulp of the story was hard to swallow.
meanings.sent5: The pulp oozed out like a blob of jelly.

meanings.definition: The soft, moist, part of fruit or vegetables.
meanings.sent1: The apple pulp was sweet and delicious.
meanings.sent2: He removed the pulp from the orange before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The pulp of the tomato made a funny squelching sound.
meanings.sent4: The pulp of the watermelon was like a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The pulp of the peach was so juicy it dripped down her chin.

meanings.definition: A magazine or book containing lurid subject matter and being characteristically printed on rough, unfinished paper.
meanings.sent1: She read a pulp novel late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The pulp magazine had thrilling stories inside.
meanings.sent3: The pulp book cover had a dramatic illustration.
meanings.sent4: The pulp fiction transported her to another world.
meanings.sent5: The pulp publication was a guilty pleasure to read.
